description: Numbers <= 3999 sorted in Roman numeral lexicographic order.
comments: Beyond 3999 the numerals are not representable in ASCII and hence sorting becomes problematic. - Steven N. Severinghaus
links: Steven N. Severinghaus, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..3999
maple: A036742 := sort([seq(convert(n, roman), n=1..3999)], lexorder): seq(convert(A036742[n], arabic), n=1..51); # Nathaniel Johnston, May 18 2011
prog: #!/bin/bash# Perl program from Steven N. Severinghaus, Nov 17 2007. Requires Roman module:# http://search.cpan.org/~chorny/Roman-1.20/lib/Roman.pmperl -e 'use Roman; for(1..3999) { print roman($_).""; }' | sort | perl -ne 'use Roman; chomp; print arabic($_).""'
author: _David W. Wilson_
